key.name: disable-csd
key.summary: Whether to disable the client-side-decorations.
key.description: If true, the default titlebar will be used as created by the WM rather then the CSD.

key.name: auto-hide-mouse
key.summary: Whether to automatically hide the mouse pointer when typing.
key.description: If true, the mouse pointer is hidden when the user starts typing and shown again when interaction with the mouse occurs.

key.name: prompt-on-new-session
key.summary: Whether to prompt for session settings or use defaults.
key.description: If true, when creating a new session a prompt will appear to pick the session name and profile used.

key.name: enable-transparency
key.summary: Whether to transparency is enabled.
key.description: If true, transparency is enabled in terminals is supported.

key.name: terminal-title-style
key.summary: The style to use for terminal titles
key.description: Which style to use for terminal titles, normal, small or none.

key.name: enable-wide-handle
key.summary: Whether splitters use a narrow (default) or wide handle
key.description: If true, splitters between terminals use a wide handle. Only supported in GTK 2.16 and later.

key.name: theme-variant
key.summary: Which theme variant to use

key.name: new-instance-mode
key.summary: Default behavior when opening a second instance of Terminix

key.name: notify-on-process-complete
key.summary: Whether to notify when a process is completed
key.description: If true, notifications will be sent when non-visible processes complete in terminals.

key.name: menu-accelerator-enabled
key.summary: Whether the standard GTK shortcut for menubar access is enabled
key.description: Normally you can access the menubar with F10. This can also be customized via gtkrc (gtk-menu-bar-accel = "whatever"). This option allows the standard menubar accelerator to be disabled.

key.name: unsafe-paste-alert
key.summary: Alert the user about unsafe paste.
key.description: If the user paste's a command into the terminal that might be considered unsafe, when them.

key.name: paste-strip-first-char
key.summary: Strip the first character from a paste if comment or variable declaration
key.description: If true, if the first character is a comment (#) or a variable declaration($) it will be stripped on paste.

key.name: search-default-match-case
key.summary: Whether to match case when searching
key.description: If true, searches will be case sensitive.

key.name: search-default-match-entire-word
key.summary: Whether to only match the entire word
key.description: If true, search must be the entire word in order to be considered a match.

key.name: search-default-match-as-regex
key.summary: Whether to match using regular expressions
key.description: If true, the search will be done treating the search text as a regular expression.

key.name: search-default-wrap-around
key.summary: Whether searches wrap the terminal buffer
key.description: If true, a search will move to the bottom of the terminal buffer when it reaches the top item and vice versa.

key.name: encodings
key.summary: List of available encodings
key.description: A subset of possible encodings are presented in the Encoding submenu. This is a list of encodings to appear there.

key.name: warn-vte-config-issue
key.summary: Whether to warn if the VTE configuration issue is detected
key.description: If true, a dialog will be displayed warning the user that VTE is not configured correctly.

key.name: focus-follow-mouse
key.summary: Whether the focus follows the mouse
key.description: If true, a terminal will automatically be focused when the mouse moves over it.

key.name: visible-name
key.summary: Human-readable name of the profile
key.description: Human-readable name of the profile.

key.name: default-size-columns
key.summary: Default number of columns
key.description: Number of columns in newly created terminal windows. Has no effect if use_custom_default_size is not enabled.

key.name: default-size-rows
key.summary: Default number of rows
key.description: Number of rows in newly created terminal windows. Has no effect if use_custom_default_size is not enabled.

key.name: cursor-blink-mode
key.summary: Whether to blink the cursor
key.description: The possible values are "system" to use the global cursor blinking settings, or "on" or "off" to set the mode explicitly.

key.name: cursor-shape
key.summary: The cursor appearance

key.name: audible-bell
key.summary: Whether to ring the terminal bell

key.name: allow-bold
key.summary: Whether to allow bold text
key.description: If true, allow applications in the terminal to make text boldface.

key.name: rewrap-on-resize
key.summary: Whether to rewrap the terminal contents on window resize

key.name: use-system-font
key.summary: Whether to use the system monospace font

key.name: font
key.summary: A Pango font name and size

key.name: background-transparency-percent
key.summary: The amount of transparency to apply to the background

key.name: dim-transparency-percent
key.summary: The amount of transparency to apply to the unfocused dim effect

key.name: foreground-color
key.summary: Default color of text in the terminal
key.description: Default color of text in the terminal, as a color specification (can be HTML-style hex digits, or a color name such as "red").

key.name: background-color
key.summary: Default color of terminal background
key.description: Default color of terminal background, as a color specification (can be HTML-style hex digits, or a color name such as "red").

key.name: cursor-colors-set
key.summary: Whether to use custom cursor colors
key.description: If true, use the cursor colors from the profile.

key.name: cursor-background-color
key.summary: Cursor background color
key.description: Custom color of the background of the terminal's cursor, as a color specification (can be HTML-style hex digits, or a color name such as "red"). This is ignored if cursor-colors-set is false.

key.name: cursor-foreground-color
key.summary: Cursor foreground colour
key.description: Custom color for the foreground of the text character at the terminal's cursor position, as a color specification (can be HTML-style hex digits, or a color name such as "red"). This is ignored if cursor-colors-set is false.

key.name: highlight-colors-set
key.summary: Whether to use custom highlight colors
key.description: If true, use the highlight colors from the profile.

key.name: highlight-background-color
key.summary: Highlight background color
key.description: Custom color of the background of the terminal's highlight, as a color specification (can be HTML-style hex digits, or a color name such as "red"). This is ignored if highlight-colors-set is false.

key.name: highlight-foreground-color
key.summary: Highlight foreground colour
key.description: Custom color for the foreground of the text character at the terminal's highlight position, as a color specification (can be HTML-style hex digits, or a color name such as "red"). This is ignored if highlight-colors-set is false.

key.name: dim-color-set
key.summary: Whether to use custom dim color
key.description: If true, use the dim color from the profile.

key.name: dim-color
key.summary: Colour to use to dim un-focused terminal
key.description: Custom color used as an overlay to create dim effect for un-focused terminal, as a color specification (can be HTML-style hex digits, or a color name such as "red").

key.name: palette
key.summary: Palette for terminal applications

key.name: use-theme-colors
key.summary: Whether to use the colors from the theme for the terminal widget

key.name: show-scrollbar
key.summary: When to show the scrollbar

key.name: scrollback-lines
key.summary: Number of lines to keep in scrollback
key.description: Number of scrollback lines to keep around. You can scroll back in the terminal by this number of lines; lines that don't fit in the scrollback are discarded. If scrollback_unlimited is true, this value is ignored.

key.name: scrollback-unlimited
key.summary: Whether an unlimited number of lines should be kept in scrollback
key.description: If true, scrollback lines will never be discarded. The scrollback history is stored on disk temporarily, so this may cause the system to run out of disk space if there is a lot of output to the terminal.

key.name: scroll-on-keystroke
key.summary: Whether to scroll to the bottom when a key is pressed
key.description: If true, pressing a key jumps the scrollbar to the bottom.

key.name: scroll-on-output
key.summary: Whether to scroll to the bottom when there's new output
key.description: If true, whenever there's new output the terminal will scroll to the bottom.

key.name: backspace-binding
key.summary: The code sequence the Backspace key generates

key.name: delete-binding
key.summary: The code sequence the Delete key generates

key.name: cjk-utf8-ambiguous-width
key.summary: Whether ambiguous-width characters are narrow or wide when using UTF-8 encoding

key.name: terminal-title
key.summary: The string to display as the terminal title
key.description: The title supports tokens which are replaced at runtime, additionally pango markup can be used as well

key.name: exit-action
key.summary: What to do with the terminal when the child command exits
key.description: Possible values are "close" to close the terminal, "restart" to restart the command, and "hold" to keep the terminal open with no command running inside.

key.name: login-shell
key.summary: Whether to launch the command in the terminal as a login shell
key.description: If true, the command inside the terminal will be launched as a login shell (argv[0] will have a hyphen in front of it).

key.name: use-custom-command
key.summary: Whether to run a custom command instead of the shell
key.description: If true, the value of the custom_command setting will be used in place of running a shell.

key.name: custom-command
key.summary: Custom command to use instead of the shell
key.description: Run this command in place of the shell, if use_custom_command is true.

key.name: encoding
key.summary: Which encoding to use

key.name: app-new-window
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to create a new window

key.name: app-new-session
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to create a new session

key.name: app-preferences
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to open preferences

key.name: app-shortcuts
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to show shortcuts

key.name: session-synchronize-input
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to synchronize input for the session

key.name: session-close
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to close a session

key.name: session-name
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to change the name of the session

key.name: session-open
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to open a previously saved session

key.name: session-save
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to save the current session

key.name: session-save-as
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to save the current session as a new file

key.name: session-switch-to-terminal-0
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to terminal 0

key.name: session-switch-to-terminal-1
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to terminal 1

key.name: session-switch-to-terminal-2
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to terminal 2

key.name: session-switch-to-terminal-3
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to terminal 3

key.name: session-switch-to-terminal-4
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to terminal 4

key.name: session-switch-to-terminal-5
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to terminal 5

key.name: session-switch-to-terminal-6
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to terminal 6

key.name: session-switch-to-terminal-7
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to terminal 7

key.name: session-switch-to-terminal-8
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to terminal 8

key.name: session-switch-to-terminal-9
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to terminal 9

key.name: session-switch-to-terminal-up
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to terminal above

key.name: session-switch-to-terminal-down
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to terminal below

key.name: session-switch-to-terminal-left
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to terminal left

key.name: session-switch-to-terminal-right
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to terminal right

key.name: session-resize-terminal-up
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to resize terminal up

key.name: session-resize-terminal-down
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to resize terminal down

key.name: session-resize-terminal-left
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to resize terminal left

key.name: session-resize-terminal-right
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to resize terminal right

key.name: win-view-sidebar
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to view session sidebar

key.name: win-switch-to-session-0
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to session 10

key.name: win-switch-to-session-1
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to session 1

key.name: win-switch-to-session-2
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to session 2

key.name: win-switch-to-session-3
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to session 3

key.name: win-switch-to-session-4
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to session 4

key.name: win-switch-to-session-5
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to session 5

key.name: win-switch-to-session-6
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to session 6

key.name: win-switch-to-session-7
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to session 7

key.name: win-switch-to-session-8
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to session 8

key.name: win-switch-to-session-9
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to session 9

key.name: win-switch-to-next-session
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to the next session

key.name: win-switch-to-previous-session
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to the previous session

key.name: win-fullscreen
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to toggle fullscreen

key.name: session-switch-to-next-terminal
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to the next terminal

key.name: session-switch-to-previous-terminal
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to switch to the previous terminal

key.name: terminal-split-right
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to split terminal right

key.name: terminal-split-down
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to split terminal down

key.name: terminal-find
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to find text in terminal

key.name: terminal-find-next
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to find next match in terminal

key.name: terminal-find-previous
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to find previous match in terminal

key.name: terminal-layout
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to set a customize layout options for the terminal

key.name: terminal-close
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to close the terminal

key.name: terminal-maximize
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to maximize or restore the terminal

key.name: terminal-profile-preference
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to edit the current profile

key.name: terminal-read-only
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to toggle whether the terminal is read-only

key.name: terminal-reset
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to reset the terminal states

key.name: terminal-reset-and-clear
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to reset the terminal states and clear the output buffer

key.name: terminal-copy
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to copy selected text in terminal

key.name: terminal-paste
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to paste text in terminal from clipboard

key.name: terminal-select-all
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to select all text in terminal

key.name: terminal-zoom-in
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to make font larger

key.name: terminal-zoom-out
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to make font smaller

key.name: terminal-zoom-normal
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to make font normal-size

key.name: terminal-save
key.summary: Keyboard shortcut to save terminal contents
